com.emc.esu.api.rest

Class DownloadHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.emc.esu.api.rest.DownloadHelper

  • public class DownloadHelper
extends Object
    Helper class to download objects. For large transfers, the content generally needs to be transferred from the server in smaller chunks. This helper class reads an object's contents incrementally from the server and writes it to a file or stream.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DownloadHelper(EsuApi esuApi, byte[] buffer)
      Creates a new download helper.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DownloadHelper

        public DownloadHelper(EsuApi esuApi,
              byte[] buffer)
        Creates a new download helper.
        Parameters:
        esuApi - the API connection object to use to communicate with the server.
        buffer - the buffer to use for the transfers from the server. If null, a default 4MB buffer will be used.

    • Method Detail

      • readObject

        public void readObject(Identifier id,
              File f)
        Downloads the given object's contents to a file.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the object to download
        f - the file to write the object's contents to.

      • readObject

        public void readObject(Identifier id,
              OutputStream stream,
              boolean closeStream)
        Downloads the given object's contents to a stream.
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the object to download.
        stream - the stream to write the object's contents to.
        closeStream - specifies whether to close the stream after the transfer is complete. Defaults to true.

        Gets the current number of bytes that have been downloaded.

        the current number of bytes downloaded.

        public boolean isComplete()
        Returns true if the transfer has completed.
        Returns:
        true if the transfer has completed, false otherwise.

      • isFailed

        public boolean isFailed()
        Returns true if the transfer has failed.

        true if the transfer has failed, false otherwise.

        If the transfer has failed, return the error that caused the failure.
        Returns:
        the error that caused the transfer to fail.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(ProgressListener listener)
        Sets a listener to provide feedback on the transfer's progress.
